sentences.sContent: She has shown no interest whatever in anything scientific.
sentences.sCn: 凡是与科学有关的她都没有表现出任何兴趣。

sentences.sContent: This is just a stupid argument that has nothing whatever to do with your job.
sentences.sCn: 这只是一场无聊的争论，和你的工作没有任何关系。

sentences.sContent: ...And there was plenty of opportunity to do whatever you felt like doing...
...They worked hard at whatever they did...
...telling them they could　achieve whatever they set their minds to...
...But do Millennials respond to these economic troubles by doing whatever it takes to make ends　meet...
...The share of older people applying for Social Security early rose quickly during the recession as people sought whatever income they could find...
...whatever his sunny speeches on the subject might suggest...
...After financial disasters family members also tend to do whatever they can to help each other and their communities...
...I suspect that whatever Facebook has done so far to invade our privacy...
...organic produce or beautiful presentation; they were looking for whatever they could get their hands on...
...but whatever you do be careful not to overdo it...

trans.tranCn: [用于否定句中以加强语气]任何； 无论什么
trans.tranOther: used to emphasize a negative statement
